newsitem.title: UK: Geo Interactive seeks AIM listing, outlines result.
newsitem.headline: Geo Interactive seeks AIM listing, outlines result.

text.p: Internet application software maker Geo Interactive Media Group Limited said it wanted to list on the Alternative Investment Market (AIM) through a placing to institutional investors, it said in a statement.
Geo said with its Pathfinder prospectus that gross profit in the seven months to July 31 were $886,000 on turnover of $1.30 million, leading to a loss for the period of $274,000.
Geo said it would incur "a high level of expenditure" during 1997 on the development of products and marketing.
But it added that this would result in a "substantial" level of revenues in 1998 and beyond.

It said it was at "an advanced stage" in negotiating a worldwide exclusive publishing and distribution contract for its Emblaze Creator, used for creating multimedia content for the Internet, with a major U.S. publishing group.
Geo said many of its management team come from an advanced high-technology development unit in the Israel Defence Forces.
